rooms.name: Enviro-Field
rooms.description: This selection vaporizes the player instantly. Game Over.

rooms.name: Docking Bay
rooms.description:
You glance around the Docking Bay. It acts as a structure jutting from the starboard side of the ship, providing room for landing and loading. 
The vast port your ship entered through generates a crackling enviro-field, holding in what little toxic atmosphere that remains. 
You cannot make out any more details due to the dim emergency lighting. 

- To the West, you see the bay doors exit.

pointsOfInterest.name: scrambler
pointsOfInterest.description:
The mk39 high-band frequency scrambler/unscrambler. AKA 'The Garage Door Opener.' 
Makes quick work of electronically locked doors.

pointsOfInterest.name: ship
pointsOfInterest.description:
The E.D.F.S. Spartan rests precariously on its twisted landing struts. Every few seconds her hull groans as Zhang shifts his weight inside. 
She's seen better days, but you're still breathing. 

You silently mouth words of appreciation.

rooms.name: Junction Hallway 1
rooms.description:
This hallway divides the ship into the stern and bow sectors. An environ-panel hangs open, the oxygen pipe here has been siphoned. 
The dim red light pervades this area, too, allowing you to barely make out the signage off 3 exits. 
It seems dumb for everything to be labeled grey, how frustrating. 

- To the North, you spot a grey stripe labeled with "Crew Bays" leading to the door. 
- To the South, you spot another grey stripe, this one doubled, labeled "Cargo/Engineering Sector". 
- To the East, you spot a final grey stripe on the open bay doors, you can vaguely make out the silhouette of your ship in the distance.

items.name: pipes
items.fullName: a panel containing a section of the ship's Atmo-Ducts, maybe there's breathable air inside the PIPES

pointsOfInterest.name: pipes
pointsOfInterest.description:
Atmo-ducting. This heap isn't producing atmosphere anymore, but if you bleed the lines a bit with your suit you might be able to 
siphon off some nearby gases in them.
pointsOfInterest.usedDescr: Atmo-ducting. You've siphoned off what you could from here, already.

rooms.name: Cargo Hold
rooms.description:
You enter the Cargo Hold. Immediately the towering rows of crates, equipment, and who knows what else cast great shadows, 
blocking the dim emergency lighting overhead. You won't be able to see anything clearly without the ship's proper warehouse lighting.

- To the North, you make out the grey stripe leading back to the door to the junction hallway.
- To the South, you barely spot the grey stripe leading to a door marked "Reactor Room"

pointsOfInterest.name: cabinet
pointsOfInterest.description:
Looking closer, you see the cabinet houses a complete industrial-capacity warp drive socket set.

This should most certainly contain the TOOL that Zhang briefed you on!
pointsOfInterest.usedDescr: The cabinet door hangs open. There isn't anything else of use inside.

rooms.name: Reactor Hallway
rooms.description:
The hall before the Reactor Room is dim red, a low hum pulses from another door marked “Power Supplies”.

- To the South, you spot the door to the Reactor Room. 
- To the East, a door marked “Power Supplies” hums with the sound of machinery.

rooms.name: Reactor Room
rooms.description:
The Reactor Room vibrates with the steady hum of the emergency generators coming through the adjoining wall.
A long console sits against the far wall, its displays dimmed out. Seems like it’s in power savings mode.

- To the North, you see the door back to the Reactor Hallway. 
- To the South, the door to “Engine Room” sits darkened.

rooms.name: Engine Room Hallway
rooms.description:
The air in the hall before the Engine Room holds the tang of burning oil, even without the Chief's expertise you can see several 
clear signs of mechanical neglect. What happened to the crew to allow things to reach this state?

- To the East, you spot the door to the Engine Room. 
- To the North, the Reactor Room.

items.name: pipes
items.fullName: a panel containing a section of the ship's Atmo-Ducts, maybe there's breathable air inside the PIPES

pointsOfInterest.name: pipes
pointsOfInterest.description:
Atmo-ducting. This heap isn't producing atmosphere anymore, but if you bleed the lines a bit with your suit you might be able to 
siphon off some nearby gases in them.
pointsOfInterest.usedDescr: Atmo-ducting. You've siphoned off what you could from here, already.

rooms.name: Engine Room
rooms.description:
The Engine Room is not so much a "room" as it is an observation platform now containing a messy makeshift workshop.
Rows of engine parts of ships of every capacity line the shelves and hang partially completed from shop chains.
A rickety steel railing separates you from the yawning cavern of the freighter's industrial capacity jump drives.

- To the West, you see the door returning to the hallway.
- To the North, you see the doors to the Power Supplies are now working.

items.name: rack
items.fullName: a ship parts RACK affixed with contraband components

pointsOfInterest.name: rack
pointsOfInterest.description:
you spot several contraband parts originating from Praetor-class vessels affixed to a parts RACK.

This place is gonna be a mountain of paperwork...
pointsOfInterest.usedDescr: the evidence teams are going to be here for years, but you have everything you need from here for now.
